title.justification: This is the title of the research paper provided by the user.

extractions.description: The paper presents neuroconnectionism as a cohesive large-scale research programme centered around artificial neural networks (ANNs) for modeling brain computations. It reviews past and present neuroconnectionist projects, their challenges, and argues that this approach is highly progressive in generating novel insights into cognitive neuroscience.

type.justification: The paper mainly deals with theoretical aspects of using ANNs to model brain computations and discusses its conceptual framework, underlying computational methods, and philosophical grounding.
type.quote: We propose that arguing about the successes and failures of a restricted set of current ANNs is the wrong approach to assess the promise of neuroconnectionism. Instead, we take inspiration from the philosophy of science, and in particular from Lakatos, who showed that the core of scientific research programmes is often not directly falsifiable, but should be assessed by its capacity to generate novel insights.

name.justification: The paper deals with the application of ANNs and their theoretical framework within the context of brain and cognitive functions, which fall under the primary domain of Neuroscience.
name.quote: We describe the core of the programme, the underlying computational framework and its tools for testing specific neuroscientific hypotheses.

name.justification: The paper extensively discusses artificial neural networks, deep learning methods, and their applications in modeling brain functions.
name.quote: To address these desiderata in a consistent explanatory framework, researchers have turned to computational modeling using Deep Neural Networks (DNNs; the latest incarnation of Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs)).

name.justification: The paper draws inspiration from the philosophy of science, particularly from Lakatos' view on scientific research programmes to conceptualize neuroconnectionism.
name.quote: we take inspiration from the philosophy of science, and in particular from Lakatos, who showed that the core of scientific research programmes is often not directly falsifiable, but should be assessed by its capacity to generate novel insights.

name.justification: The concept of Deep Neural Networks is central to the paper's discussion on modeling brain computations.
name.quote: To address these desiderata in a consistent explanatory framework, researchers have turned to computational modeling using Deep Neural Networks (DNNs; the latest incarnation of Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs)).

is_contributed.justification: Deep Neural Networks are a pre-existing concept and not a new contribution in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: To address these desiderata in a consistent explanatory framework, researchers have turned to computational modeling using Deep Neural Networks (DNNs; the latest incarnation of Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs)).

is_executed.justification: There is no specific mention of executing Deep Neural Networks on GPU or CPU within the paper.
is_executed.quote: There is no specific mention of executing Deep Neural Networks on GPU or CPU within the paper.

is_compared.justification: The paper discusses and compares Deep Neural Networks with biological cognition and discusses their strengths and limitations.
is_compared.quote: The paper discusses the strengths and limitations of ANNs compared to biological cognition.

name.justification: Convolutional Neural Networks are discussed as a specific type of DNN used in visual neuroscience.
name.quote: The earliest such update was a result of the recognition that the feed-forward nature of standard convolutional networks was both obviously incongruent with real neural anatomy, and functionally limiting.

is_contributed.justification: Convolutional Neural Networks are a pre-existing model and not a new contribution in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Convolutional Neural Networks are discussed as a specific type of DNN used in visual neuroscience.

is_compared.quote: The earliest such update was a result of the recognition that the feed-forward nature of standard convolutional networks was both obviously incongruent with real neural anatomy, and functionally limiting.

referenced_paper_title.value: ImageNet classification with deep convolutional neural networks
referenced_paper_title.justification: This referenced paper presents the well-known architecture of Convolutional Neural Networks used in the context of image recognition.

name.justification: Recurrent Neural Networks are discussed as models that incorporate recurrence to better align with the brain's computations.
name.quote: It was shown that recurrent networks were better at matching both behavioral data and neural activity patterns that occur with longer delays.

is_contributed.justification: Recurrent Neural Networks are a pre-existing model and not a new contribution in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Recurrent Neural Networks are discussed as models that incorporate recurrence to better align with the brain's computations.

is_executed.justification: There is no specific mention of executing Recurrent Neural Networks on GPU or CPU within the paper.
is_executed.quote: There is no specific mention of executing Recurrent Neural Networks on GPU or CPU within the paper.

is_compared.justification: The paper discusses the impact of incorporating recurrent connections in neural networks and compares them to feed-forward networks.
is_compared.quote: It was shown that recurrent networks were better at matching both behavioral data and neural activity patterns that occur with longer delays.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This referenced paper is a foundational work on the use of gradient-based learning methods in Recurrent Neural Networks.
